page.title: 19EASTON WEIR
page.content: Easton is a small village outside Huntingdon with a population of approximately two hundred people. It is a very old site with a lot of history behind it. There is an old weir there which is now filled with sewage.Once it had pure water in it,and when the Black Death came to Easton from the neighbouring village of Grafham clean water was very rare. People came from all around to drink the water, so a cobbled path was built leading down to the weir. The wier is used for dumping rubbish, and it is black with rotting leaves. it is marshy and boggy, and no attempt has been made to clear it up, although it has so much history behind it.
